result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Defendant Calliston J Stimac in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Calliston J Stimac. 
Scott Killian is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. He is a police officer with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. On 4/30/22, he was dispatched to the Baker Street IGA regarding a retail theft. Officer Zaleski was outside and he was inside talking to employees. Officer Zaleski observed a vehicle leave and go across the street. He followed the vehicle and the defendant was the driver of the vehicle. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. They observed the aluminum foil that was taken from the store and they searched the vehicle and the defendant. He found a cut straw and a gem baggie. They found a bindle on the defendant and it tested positive for opiates. Other bindles of opiates were found in the vehicle. Based on the way the bindles were packaged and the weight, he feels it was intended to be delivered. Defendant was on bond on another case at the time of this incident. Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness.  
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Not guilty plea to all counts. Attorney Kryshak withdraws motion for bond modification. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Amend Bond
